decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
Drawing no: Ordinance Survey 100054135 (Site Location Plan)Dated 25th April 2025 
Drawing no: 2832025/650/2(Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Proposed Roof Plan, Proposed Rear Elevation Plan, Proposed Sides Elevations Plans, And  Proposed Section A-A Plan) Dated 25 April 2025 
Site Photographs showing the Front Elevation submitted on Wednesday, 21 May 2025 and the Rear Elevations Site Photographs submitted on Friday 23 May 2025 by the Agent Fleur Baxter Warman

Condition : 2 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part  1 of Schedule   2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in Class  A . The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - The development is only just within Permitted Development tolerances in terms of  Depth   and  Height . You are advised to complete the development in full accordance with the plans, as if the development is Deeper and higher than that covered by this Certificate a breach of planning control could result.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPESCT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION.
